newsitem.title: SWEDEN: IBCA assigns longterm AAA rating Dexia Kommunbank.
newsitem.headline: IBCA assigns longterm AAA rating Dexia Kommunbank.

text.p: European credit ratings agency IBCA said on Thursday it had assigned a long term rating of AAA to Dexia Kommunbank AB, the wholly-owned Swedish subsidiary of Credit Local de France.
IBCA said it assigned a short term rating of A1+ to Dexia Kommunbank.

"The ratings have been assigned on the basis that all Dexia Kommunbank's liabilities are unconditionally and irrevocably guaranteed by its parent (which enjoys the same ratings)," the agency said in a statement.
Dexia Kommunbank started operations in 1996, based in Stockholm.
Its main activity is the financing of Swedish local authorities and it is the first bank to specialise in lending to this sector on the Swedish market.
At the end of 1996 it had total loans outstanding of over 750 million crowns.

"Management expects to develop its lending activities significantly in 1997, focusing on loans to regional and local governments as well as public sector companies, particularly in the energy and housing sector," IBCA said.

Credit Local de France has recently announced an alliance with Credit Communal de Belgique with the new group called Dexia. IBCA said this had confirmed its positions as the leading provider of local authority finance in Europe.
